results.title: Delayed inflammatory reaction to hyaluronic acid filler following Shingrix and Fluzone vaccines treated with lisinopril

results.title: Impact of lisinopril on cisplatin-induced inflammation, oxidative stress, apoptosis, and impaired steroidogenesis in rat testis: involvement of Nrf2/Keap1/HO-1 and PPARgamma signaling.
results.text_hl: This study investigates, for the first time, the ability of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@LSP@@@ to counteract @CHEMICAL_Cisplatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002945 @@@CDDP@@@-induced @<m>DISEASE_Inflammation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammation@@@, oxidative stress, apoptosis, and steroidogenic disturbances in @SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@ testis.

citations.NLM: Arafa EA, Hassanein EHM, Hussein RM, Mohamed WR. results.title: Targeting inflammation and redox perturbations by lisinopril mitigates Freund's adjuvant-induced arthritis in rats: role of JAK-2/STAT-3/RANKL axis, MMPs, and VEGF.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSION: @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@ attenuated adjuvant-induced @DISEASE_Arthritis @DISEASE_MESH:D001168 @@@arthritis@@@ via inhibition of @<m>DISEASE_Inflammation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammation@@@, articular degradation cues, and angiogenesis.

results.title: Treatment With Lisinopril Prevents the Early Progression of Glomerular Injury in Obese Dahl Salt-Sensitive Rats Independent of Lowering Arterial Pressure
results.text_hl: Chronic treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ significantly decreased @DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@glomerular injury@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Inflammation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@renal inflammation@@@ in the SSLepRmutant @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

results.title: Therapeutic effects of lisinopril and empagliflozin in a mouse model of hypertension-accelerated diabetic kidney disease.
results.text_hl: Total glomerular numbers and individual glomerular volume were evaluated by whole kidney three-dimensional imaging analysis. db/db UNx-ReninAAV @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ developed hallmarks of progressive @DISEASE_Diabetic_Nephropathies @DISEASE_MESH:D003928 @@@DKD@@@ characterized by severe @DISEASE_Albuminuria @DISEASE_MESH:D000419 @@@albuminuria@@@, advanced @DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis @DISEASE_MESH:D005921 @@@glomerulosclerosis@@@, and @DISEASE_Hypertrophy @DISEASE_MESH:D006984 @@@glomerular hypertrophy@@@. @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@ significantly improved @DISEASE_Albuminuria @DISEASE_MESH:D000419 @@@albuminuria@@@, @DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis @DISEASE_MESH:D005921 @@@glomerulosclerosis@@@, @DISEASE_Nephritis_Interstitial @DISEASE_MESH:D009395 @@@tubulointerstitial injury@@@, and @<m>DISEASE_Inflammation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammation@@@.

Therapeutic effects of lisinopril and empagliflozin in a mouse model of hypertension-accelerated diabetic kidney disease. Am J Physiol Renal Physiol. 2021 Aug 1;321(2):F149-F161. PMID: 34180715

results.title: The effect of diminazene, an angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 activator, on adenine-induced chronic kidney disease in rats.
results.text_hl: The protective effect of the three drugs used is, at least partially, due to their anti-@<m>DISEASE_Inflammation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ and antioxidant effects.

results.title: Clofibrate, a PPAR-alpha agonist, abrogates sodium fluoride-induced neuroinflammation, oxidative stress, and motor incoordination via modulation of GFAP/Iba-1/anti-calbindin signaling pathways.
results.text_hl: Overall, cotreatment of @CHEMICAL_Sodium_Fluoride @CHEMICAL_MESH:D012969 @@@NaF@@@ with either @CHEMICAL_Clofibrate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002994 @@@clofibrate@@@ or @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ showed neuroprotective effects by mitigating @<m>DISEASE_Inflammation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@neuronal inflammation@@@ and oxidative and @DISEASE_Motor_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D000068079 @@@motor@@@ @DISEASE_Ataxia @DISEASE_MESH:D001259 @@@incoordination@@@.

results.title: Peripherally derived angiotensin converting enzyme-enhanced macrophages alleviate Alzheimer-related disease.
results.text_hl: Beneficial ACE10 phenotype was reversed by the @GENE_ACE @GENE_11421 @@@angiotensin-converting enzyme@@@ inhibitor (@<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@) and thus was dependent on @GENE_ACE @GENE_11421 @@@angiotensin-converting enzyme@@@ catalytic activity.

results.title: An Unusual Cause of Anaemia of Chronic Disease: Lisinopril-Induced Chronic Inflammatory State
results.text_hl: Evidence that the cause of her symptoms was a systemic @<m>DISEASE_Inflammation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ reaction to @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ is circumstantial but strongly supported by the onset and subsequent decline of local @DISEASE_Signs_and_Symptoms_Digestive @DISEASE_MESH:D012817 @@@(upper gastrointestinal) symptoms@@@, systemic symptoms (malaise, @DISEASE_Anorexia @DISEASE_MESH:D000855 @@@anorexia@@@, @DISEASE_Weight_Loss @DISEASE_MESH:D015431 @@@weight loss@@@), and the systemic @<m>DISEASE_Inflammation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ response.

citations.NLM: Eyre T, Van-Hamel-Parsons V, Wang LM, Hughes KA, Littlewood TJ. An Unusual Cause of Anaemia of Chronic Disease: Lisinopril-Induced Chronic Inflammatory State Case Rep Hematol. 2011;2011():939080. PMID: 22937315

results.title: Toxicodynamic analysis of inflammatory reactions by an angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor (lisinopril) in guinea-pig skin.
results.text_hl: @<m>DISEASE_Inflammation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@Inflammatory@@@ responses were dose-dependently enhanced by treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@.
